pr_title: Add Preference: Disable "Card Browser" context menu

timeline.bodyText: This is an odd one to think about, why would we string format a translation string into a translation? Seems like either the 'card_browser_enable_external_context_menu' string names should be generic (not card browser specific) (even though we only have one?) or should just contain the whole string?
timeline.author: mikehardy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,8 @@
     <string name="gestures_tap_right">Touch right</string>
     <string name="more_scrolling_buttons">eReader</string>
     <string name="more_scrolling_buttons_summ">Also use kanji/katakana, emoji/kao-moji buttons for scrolling</string>
+    <string name="card_browser_enable_external_context_menu">‘%s’ Menu</string>
+    <string name="card_browser_enable_external_context_menu_summary">Enables the ‘%s’ context menu globally</string>

replies.bodyText:
Mostly for reuse and to ensure consistency if the menu text changes. I'd rather have the indirection

Personal note: Maybe we shouldn't be using Context to format the strings here, as it doesn't necessarily reflect the app language
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: either consistent with #4729 fix or a FIXME note perhaps
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: AFAIK, the strings in the Manifest rely on the system language, I haven't found a way to modify them
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message:
Preference: Disable "Card Browser" context menu

We can do this via defining an activity alias, then disabling it in the
system.

According to StackOverflow, this is persisted until uninstall/reinstall
but it's unknown whether this affects updates.

It doesn't matter, as we perform the check on startup.

This commit also changes the menu to make it localizable. This is based
on the system language.

Fixes #6226
